subject: Re: [junit] fresher doubt
msgSnippet: ... Why on Earth don t you have a copy of _JUnit Recipes_!? Several hundred of your friends do! Take care. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Larry Tambascio wrote:

> I would recommend reading JUnit in Action and/or Pragmatic Unit
> Testing. This will give you a good understanding of automated unit
> testing. I haven't read JB's book JUnit Recipes (yet), so I can't in
> all honesty recommend it, but I imagine it will be helpful.

Why on Earth don't you have a copy of _JUnit Recipes_!? Several hundred
of your friends do!

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
